activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad Ray Gatten

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
1:46 PM Defendant Chad Ray Gatten appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Chad Ray Gatten.
Covers 22CF176, 22CF118, 22CF185, 22TR608 and 22TR610
1:47 Attorney Rockow and Defendant put in a break out room. 1:52 Attorney Rockow relates.

22CF176 Preliminary Hearing:  Defendant waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions Defendant.  Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given.  Court finds probable cause and binds over.  Request for Substitution needs to be processed by Judge Bitney and case assigned to Judge Boyle.  Next date before Judge Boyle.

22CF118 Arraignment:  Reading of Information waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Hearing set for 11/10/22 at 1:30 p.m.

22CF185 AIA:  Attorney Rockow requests case track.  Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing set for 11/10/22 at 1:30 p.m.  Attorney Rockow requests bond modification. State relates.  Court relates and modifies bond to $250.00 cash with all of the same conditions.

22TR608 - Continue to track.

22TR610 - Not guilty plea entered.  Continue to track.
Arraignment scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:28 PM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Chad Ray Gatten in court.  Attorney Dustin Rockow appears in person. This covers cases 22CF118, 22CF176, 22TR608 & 22TR610.

22CF118 - 1:34 Deputy Donald Weise, Barron County Sheriff's Department, called, sworn, and direct by state.  1:36  Witness identifies DE. 1:38  Cross by Attorney Rockow. Court finds probable cause and binds over.  Bond continues. 

22CF176 - Attorney Rockow relates, waives reading, and requests preliminary examination. Court sets Preliminary Examination for 8/26/2022 at 1:45 PM. All files track to this date. Bond Continues. 

22TR608 - Attorney Rockow relates and requests refusal hearing be held immediately before the trial as he has not yet received all discovery.  State does not object.  Tracks to 8/26/2022 date with other cases. 

22TR610 - Hearing set for 8/26/2022 at 1:45 PM.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

Must not possess or consume any intoxicating beverages anyplace, anywhere or anytime including their own home.
Must not go anywhere alcohol is either sold or served for consumption on the premises.
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

1:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chad Ray Gatten appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alex Kitto appeared by video for Chad Ray Gatten.
Court relates.  Eligible for Public Defender.  State requests cash bond.  Attorney Kitto requests signature bond.  Court orders cash bond.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm before Judge Boyle.
